body_html:
In eager mode (which you turned on with tf.enable_eager_execution), variables are initialized as soon as they are created, so you don't need global_variables_initializer and local_variables_initializer, and you should not create a Session at all.

You also need not explicitly create an iterator for datasets in eager mode. In eager, you can iterate over datasets as follows:

for x in int_dataset:
  print(x)

Check out the eager execution guide on the tensorflow website for more information.

(Note that even in non-eager mode, you should never create a Session in a tf.data map function!).

Our error message here in tf.data could have been more helpful, and I'll look into how we can improve it.
body_text:
In eager mode (which you turned on with tf.enable_eager_execution), variables are initialized as soon as they are created, so you don't need global_variables_initializer and local_variables_initializer, and you should not create a Session at all.
You also need not explicitly create an iterator for datasets in eager mode. In eager, you can iterate over datasets as follows:
for x in int_dataset:
  print(x)

Check out the eager execution guide on the tensorflow website for more information.
(Note that even in non-eager mode, you should never create a Session in a tf.data map function!).
Our error message here in tf.data could have been more helpful, and I'll look into how we can improve it.
body:
In eager mode (which you turned on with `tf.enable_eager_execution`), variables are initialized as soon as they are created, so you don't need `global_variables_initializer` and `local_variables_initializer`, and you should not create a `Session` at all.

You also need not explicitly create an iterator for datasets in eager mode. In eager, you can iterate over datasets as follows: 

```
for x in int_dataset:
  print(x)
```

Check out the [eager execution guide](https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/eager) on the tensorflow website for more information.

(Note that even in non-eager mode, you should never create a `Session` in a tf.data map function!). 

Our error message here in tf.data could have been more helpful, and I'll look into how we can improve it.
